## Esna 112 {-}

- Location: Intercolumnar E  
- Date: Domitian  
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna002.pdf#page=285){target="_blank"}  
- Bibliography: None  
  
  
#### Formula {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^1^ *ỉȝw n=k*   
*pȝ bȝ ʿȝ-ỉrw  *  
*wr-nrw štȝ-*^2^*ms.w  *  
*nṯr wʿ ḫpr m ḥḥ(.w) *  
*qmȝ nty nb ḫpr=f  *  
   
^1^ Greetings to you,  
o Ba, great of form,  
great of fear, remote ^2^ of appearance,  
sole god who transformed into millions,  
who created all that is when he came about.  
  
</div>  
  
#### The King {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^3^ *nsw.t-bỉty  *  
*(wytqrtr ksrs) *  
^4^ *zȝ-Rʿ  *  
*(twm[t]yns ḫwỉ) *  
  
^3^ King of Upper and Lower Egypt,  
Autokrator Caesar,  
^4^ Son of Re,  
Domitian, Augustus  
  
</div>  
  
#### Nekhbet (vulture) {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^5^ *Nḫb.t ỉr.t wnm.t n* ^6^ *Itm  *  
^7^ *mry  *  
*dỉ(.) ʿnḫ-ḏd-wȝs nb  *  
  *snb nb  *  
  ^8^ *ȝw.t-ỉb nb ḥr s.t-ḥr  *  
  
^5^ Nekhbet, the right eye of ^6^ Atum,  
^7^ beloved,   
who gives all *ʿnḫ-ḏd-wȝs*,  
   all health,  
   ^8^ all happiness upon the throne of Horus.  
</div>  
  
#### Behind the king {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^9^ *nṯr nfr ỉr ḥk(nw)[...]*  
  
^9^ The good god, who makes praises [...]  
</div>  
  
#### Ram-headed Crocodile {-}  
  
<div class="col2">  
  
^10^ *šsr-tȝ ḫpr m* ^11^ *zp tpy  *  
*šȝʿ Nwn* ^12^ *ms pȝwty  *  
  *ỉs tȝ m Nwn m nn  *  
*nḥm s(w) šzp  *  
  *wn(.w) m kkw  *  
    
^13^ *ỉwn ḫnt  *  
*pr=sn m n.t  *  
*kȝ=sn ḏsr   *  
  *m ẖnmw-[Rʿ] nb tȝ-sn.t  *  
   
^10^ *šsr-tȝ*(?) [^fn-112-1] who came about in the first moment,  
who began Nun, who birthed the primeval one,  
   while the earth was in Nun and inert,  
light captured it (earth),  
   when it had been in darkness.  
  
^13^ The pillar of wind and the crocodile:  
they both emerged from the flood,  
their name is sacred    
   as Khnum-[Re][^fn-112-2], lord of Esna.  
</div>  
  
  
#### Wadjet (cobra) {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^14^ *wȝḏy.t ỉr.t ỉȝbt.t n Itm  *  
  
^14^ Wadjet, the leftt eye of Atum.  
</div>  
  
#### Behind Wadjet {-}  
  
<div class="col2">  
  
^15^ *nsw.t-bỉty  *  
*swȝš ḥknw n kȝ n pȝwty  *  
*ẖnm[...] m [...]  *  
  
^15^ The King of Upper and Lower Egypt,  
who utters praises for the Ka of the Primeval One,  
[...]  
</div>  
  
[^fn-112-1]: ![](images/112_1.png){width=20%}: The reading is not entirely certain, and it is unclear if this is an epithet or a divine name for the ram-headed crocodile. *LGG* VII, 128a, cites only this example, tentatively translating: "Der das Land erleuchtet."  
  
[^fn-112-2]: The element for "Re" is damaged, but Sauneron suggested it might be: ![](images/112_2.png){width=12%}. Thus a graphic allusion to Re emerging from the flood, as described in the present text.
